edu.nyu.cs.javagit.client

Interface IGitClone

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CliGitClone

    public interface IGitClone
    An interface to represent the git-clone command. Clones a repository into a new directory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath, GitCloneOptions options, java.net.URL repository)
      Clones a git repository with specified options in default directory i.e.
      GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath, GitCloneOptions options, java.net.URL repository, java.io.File directory)
      Clones a git repository into given directory, with the specified options.
      GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath, java.net.URL repository)
      Clones a git repository, without any option, in default directory i.e.
      GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath, java.net.URL repository, java.io.File directory)
      Clones a git repository into given directory, without any option.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath,
                     java.net.URL repository)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              JavaGitException
        Clones a git repository, without any option, in default directory i.e. the directory name which the URL contains.
        Parameters:
        workingDirectoryPath - A File instance for the path to the working directory. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        repository - A URL instance for the repository to be cloned. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The result of the git clone.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • a command is not found on the PATH
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-clone.

      • clone

        GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath,
                     GitCloneOptions options,
                     java.net.URL repository)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              JavaGitException
        Clones a git repository with specified options in default directory i.e. the directory name which the URL contains.
        Parameters:
        workingDirectoryPath - A File instance for the path to the working directory. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        options - The options for the git-clone command. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        repository - A URL instance for the repository to be cloned. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The result of the git clone.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • a command is not found on the PATH
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-clone.

      • clone

        GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath,
                     java.net.URL repository,
                     java.io.File directory)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              JavaGitException
        Clones a git repository into given directory, without any option.
        Parameters:
        workingDirectoryPath - A File instance for the path to the working directory. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        repository - A URL instance for the repository to be cloned. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        directory - A File instance for the directory where the repository is to be cloned. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The result of the git clone.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • a command is not found on the PATH
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-clone.

      • clone

        GitCloneResponse clone(java.io.File workingDirectoryPath,
                     GitCloneOptions options,
                     java.net.URL repository,
                     java.io.File directory)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              JavaGitException
        Clones a git repository into given directory, with the specified options.
        Parameters:
        workingDirectoryPath - A File instance for the path to the working directory. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        options - The options for the git-clone command. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        repository - A URL instance for the repository to be cloned. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        directory - A File instance for the directory where the repository is to be cloned. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The result of the git clone.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • a command is not found on the PATH
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-clone.
